meanings.definition: A group of naturally occurring polysaccharides.
meanings.sent1: Inulins are complex sugars found in nature.
meanings.sent2: Many plants contain inulins as part of their structure.
meanings.sent3: The inulins in plants help them store energy efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The inulins act like a hidden network within the plants.
meanings.sent5: Scientists study inulins to understand their role in biology.

meanings.definition: A type of dietary fiber found in certain plants.
meanings.sent1: Including inulins in your diet can improve digestion.
meanings.sent2: Some vegetables are rich in inulins, promoting gut health.
meanings.sent3: Eating foods with inulins can make your stomach happy.
meanings.sent4: The inulins in these plants are like tiny brooms for your intestines.
meanings.sent5: Remember to consume inulins for a healthy digestive system.

meanings.definition: A substance used as a prebiotic in food products.
meanings.sent1: Inulins are added to some foods to support good bacteria.
meanings.sent2: Food manufacturers often include inulins for their health benefits.
meanings.sent3: The inulins in snacks keep your gut microbes smiling.
meanings.sent4: Inulins are like a feast for the beneficial bacteria in your gut.
meanings.sent5: Consuming inulins regularly can boost your gut health.
